intro: Tamonea euphrasiifolia, commonly known as the purple tansy, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a slender, erect stem and produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Tamonea euphrasiifolia is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
